name: Social Networking Forum

address: Silicon Valley, Third floor, Vitthal Charani Sankul

briefDescription: While social media was used to spread religious and political unrest, social worker Pramod Gaikwad from Nashik city of Maharashtra (India) thought to use this platform for social causes through the movement "Social Networking For Social Cause" in the year 2010 on Social Media. This informal movement was later on institutionalized as 'Social Networking Forum (SNF)' The movement has received great response from the Indian youths and NRIs. The organizationâ€™s main aims include resolving drinking water problems in rural and tribal areas in accordance with three tier special method designed by our NGO known as SNF Pattern which includes fund raised by social net-workers, expertise of forum and and volunteering by villagers.
